description: An example of a dashboard which can display logs

panels.description: A simple description of the dashboard

options.content:
# üîç Simple Log Viewer: `bootstrap.log`

This dashboard demonstrates how Grafana can be used to visualize logs from a local file, in this case:

Using Grafana and Loki (or a compatible log datasource), we can:
- View live log streams
- Filter logs by content or time
- Explore system activity during boot

This is a minimal example meant to show how easy it is to get started with log observability using Grafana.

You can view the contents of the file `/var/log/bootstrap.log` below. 
You can also filter the logs by using the 'Line Filter' text box above. 

## Changing the File You're Viewing
If you wish to, you can modify the log file viewed by editing the panel below. 
Click on the three dots at the top of the panel, scroll to the bottom of the page, and change the file `filename` must equal.

panels.title: Dashboard Overview

list.description:
Filters the contents of the log output. Does nothing if empty.
*(Case Insensitive)*
